listitem.para: When pluto is logging to a file, as specified by logfile=, open the log file in append mode or truncate mode. Since, on modern systems, &pluto; is restarted by other daemons, such as &systemd;, this option should be left as its default, yes, to preserve the log entries of previous runs of &pluto;.
This option is mainly intended for developers when running the test suite, which needs to create new log files from scratch.
Prior to &Libreswan; version 5.3 &pluto;, when invoked without a config file, would set this option to no.
